education.institution: Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago, IL

volunteer.summary: Lead developer for beacon technology project
highlights: Participated in discussions on how to integrate beacon technology to a campus setting
Researched how Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) works and the protocols used during communication

Developed bIIT, an android application, to detect nearby BLE beacons, to notify the user with relevant notifications dependent on the beacon, and to display nearby beacons on a campus map based on the filter set by the user
Integrated 3rd party APIs to add additional features such as displaying a versatile campus map
Designed the necessary icons, and the user interface layout of the application

volunteer.summary: Developer for Android game, Shape Shifter
highlights: Single handedly developed Shape Shifter, a mobile android game, and published on Google Play
Integrated Google Play services to display user data such as local and global high scores
Wrote a custom, mobile friendly shader to simplify lighting; written in C for Graphics (Cg)
Organized and flagged photos by the quality of the shot
Edited wedding photos (color adjustment, cropping, straightening, spot removing) in Adobe Lighthouse
Printed photos to make wedding albums

volunteer.summary: Operator for video and sound and edited the shot videos
highlights: Shot videos using a DSLR camera for school events and behind the scenes of photo shoots
Edited videos for the school using Premiere Pro
Camera operator and editor for the school introductory video
